ovdesc.p: Specify the parameter details like Accounts / Category details , match criteria, moving to History etc related to AC.EXPECTED.RECS.
AC.EXPECTED.RECS is created to keep track of Funds which are likely to be Paid/ received on the future date and based on this record the account projected balance can be determined.
The allowed values for ID is SYSTEM or COVER.
A record with Id as "SYSTEM" is required to handle expected Receipt/Payments through AC.EXPECTED.RECS.
"COVER" as id is created for tracking of Correspondent Bank cover limits while processing Inward Messages (MT103) through OFS.GLOBUS.MANAGER.
See User Guide for Funds Transfer/ Application Delivery for more details.

desc.p: Valid ID to this application are "SYSTEM" or "COVER".
ID "System" is used to specify parameters related to Expected Receipts and Payments functionality.
ID "Cover" is used to specify parameters related to Cover limit processing.

In AC.EXPECTED.RECS, when RC (Received Cover) is not available, EC (Expected Cover) record is created for Inward MT103 messages during Correspodent Cover Limit processing . Whenever RC is received , same is matched with EC.

Incase the EC record remains unmatched from Date.Entered for more than the days specified here, then MT195 (Queries) is sent to the Sender of MT103 for clarification about the message with tag 75 as "'/2/".
Incase Request.Query details given in the respective AC.EXPECTED.RECS, then same is used in tag 75 of MT195.
Mandatory Input for ID = "COVER" otherwise Not allowed

This will be the tolerance for the related multi-value, explained above. If there is no tolerance entered then there must be an exact match on the related field. There will be some fields where having a tolerance is pointless, such as narrative, but this will be up to the bank to decide and no controls will be added for that here.
Currently, the system can handle tolerances on CCY.AMOUNT and the VALUE.DATE. When the tolerance is defined, the system will first try to match with the exact keys.
If no match is found then the tolerances defined are used for calculating/determining the tolerance keys on the record to be matched. The matching process is repeated to find the tolerance match.

It should be noted that the match on the ACCOUNT.ID, VALUE.DATE and CCY.AMOUNT are mandatory for EXP.FUND.TYPE: ER and EP and for EXP.FUND.TYPE : ERR, the match on the ACCOUNT.ID, CCY.AMOUNT are mandatory
CCY.AMOUNT
The tolerance on amount is entered as a percentage. This is a plus and minus tolerance with a maximum permitted tolerance of 10.

The expected and receipts will be matched when the amount is within the tolerance limits, if specified. The lower and higher tolerance amount is calculated on the expected amount. The amount on received record should be within these limits. In the event of their being more than one record matched within the limits the first record from the selected list is matched, this may not be the closest matched record.
VALUE.DATE

The tolerance for the VALUE.DATE is in number of days and expected funds with receipt funds will be matched when the value dates are with in the tolerance date. This is plus and minus number of calendar days. A maximum value of plus/minus 9 days is permitted.
When there is a match under these conditions then the amount expected and received will be shown on the different value dates on the ACCOUNT file on the ER.VALUE.DATE and ER.BALANCE.
The receipts will be in negative where as the expected will be positive.

If it is required to correct the ER.BALANCE in the system for a particular account, it will be necessary manually create opposite records; one for the expected funds and another for the receipt funds.
